Berkeley Fluids Seminar

University of California, Berkeley

Bring your lunch and enjoy learning about fluids!

Information

What: Fluids

When: Mondays, 12 noon

Where: 3110, Etcheverry Hall

Faculty

Spring 2017

Monday, January 30, 2017

Prof. Andrew Szeri (Mechanical Engineering, UC Berkeley)

Monday, Febuary 6, 2017

Dr. Nimish Pujara (Civil Engineering, UC Berkeley)

Flow due to waves on a beach


Monday, Febuary 13, 2017

Dr. B. Emek Abali (Mechanical Engineering, UC Berkeley)

Magnetohydrodynamics in Metal Smelting


Monday, Febuary 27, 2017

Dr. Andy Nonaka (Lawrence Berkeley Lab.)

From Microscale Flow to Exploding Stars


Monday, March 6, 2017

Dr. Jongmin Seo (Stanford University)

Drag reduction and mechanism of bubble depletion in turbulent flows over superhydrophobic surfaces


Monday, March 13, 2017

Dr. Ruo-Qian (Roger) Wang

Data-Driven Analysis for Future Water Infrastructure


Monday, March 20, 2017

Dr. Jin-Han XIE (Physics, UC Berkeley)

A reduced model for salt-finger convection in the small diffusivity ratio limit


Monday, April 3, 2017

Dr. Yiran Zhang (Chemical Engineering, UC Berkeley)

Soapy Shades of Grey: Dynamics of Stratifying Foam Films


Monday, April 17, 2017

Dr. Cyprien Soulaine (Stanford)

Monday, April 24, 2017

Dr. Carl Shreck (UC Berkeley)

Cooperative evolutionary dynamics in mechanically-driven microbial colonies


Monday, May 8, 2017

Vineeth (Vinny) Chandran Suja (Stanford)

Thursday, May 25, 2016

Dr. Louis-Alexandre Couston (CNRS, France)

Dynamics of mixed convective--stably-stratified fluids, and the emergence of a mean flow
